intro: Solanum camranhense, commonly known as the Camarões tomato, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange fruits that are typically harvested when they are still firm. It is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its unique appearance and potential culinary uses, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
